project.name: angular-material-tailwind-design-system
project.description: Angular 19-based design system using Material UI 19, Tailwind CSS 4, Storybook 8, and Compodoc.

folders.description: Source of truth for UI components, tokens, themes, and utilities.
Atomic or Material-based UI components with Tailwind classes.
Design tokens like colors, spacing, font-sizes (exported via SCSS/TS).
Configuration for Storybook 8 â€” uses Angular + Tailwind setup.

component.style: Use Angular standalone components with SCAM pattern where applicable.
component.tailwind: Prefer Tailwind utility classes; override or extend via tailwind.config.ts if needed.
component.material: Use Angular Material components and extend via Tailwind when required.
component.naming: Use PascalCase for component names and kebab-case for filenames.
component.docs: Each component must have a Storybook story and Compodoc comments on inputs/outputs.

storybook.structure: Place stories next to component files using .stories.ts format.
storybook.controls: Use Storybook controls for all inputs/outputs and states.
storybook.variants: Document multiple visual states using named exports (e.g., Primary, Disabled).

compodoc.usage: Run Compodoc on libs/design-system and link docs in Storybook where helpful.

tests.unit: Write Jest or Angular TestBed tests for all components inside __tests__ folders.

start: Break down Material components into your own design-layer components for reuse.
Create design tokens (colors, font sizes, spacing) in a separate tokens.ts or SCSS file.
Write Storybook stories for every reusable component from the beginning.
Ensure every component has docs using Compodoc with @Input/@Output annotated.
